intro: Chloranthus holostegius var. shimianensis, commonly known as the Shimian chloranthus, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Sichuan, China. It belongs to the family Lauraceae and is characterized by its small, greenish-yellow flowers and simple, opposite leaves. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist forest understories, thriving in cool and humid climates. Its botanical features include a woody stem and elliptical leaves with a smooth surface. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable species for botanical study and conservation efforts.
